name: VOXON
tag_list: volumetric, 3d, kinect, holographic, tv, display, voxel
overview:
VOXON is the manufacturer of the VoxieBox - the first volumetric 3D display priced within reach of developers and consumers - that lets you experience near-holographic content viewable without glasses in 360 degrees. Such devices have previously cost upwards of US$30k - the VoxieBox will take advantage of recent advances in hardware and a novel design to make early developer kits available in the sub US$3k price range in order to build out games, applications, and volumetric 3D video content for the VoxieShop app store.

The company is founded by Alan Jackson and Sean Kean. Alan is the inventor of The Quantum Atom - an interactive exhibit at the New York Hall of Science since the 1980’s which uses lasers and unique swept volume mechanism to paint the states of the Hydrogen atom into 3D space. Sean Kean is the co-author of Meet the Kinect ( http://meetthekinect.com ), organizer of the Volumetric Society of NYC ( http://meetup.com/volumetric ), and co-founder of VOLUMETRIC Magazine ( http://volumetric.co ).
